organization.$: Department of Metallurgy and Materials Engineering

head.citation-title: Effect of sintering rate on the porous microstructural, mechanical and thermomechanical properties of YSZ and CSZ TBC coatings undergoing thermal cycling
head.abstracts: © 2017In high-temperature applications such as hot sections of gas turbines, the sintering rate of the porous microstructure of a ceramic coating, and their mechanical and thermomechanical properties are important parameters for thermal barrier coating systems. In the present research, hardness, elastic modulus, thermal expansion, thermal stress and sintering rate of the porous microstructure of yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) and ceria-stabilized zirconia (CSZ) were investigated and compared using the thermal spray technique on IN738LC base metal in thermal cycling to 1100 °C. To determine the structural and phase characteristics of the coatings, scanning electron microscopy (SEM) and X-ray diffraction (XRD) analysis were employed. The experimental results showed that the CSZ coatings exhibit a considerably better sintering rate of the porous microstructure resulting in better mechanical, and thermomechanical properties when compared to the YSZ coatings. Moreover, the study of microstructures of coatings showed that the CSZ coating is formed with a laminar and porous structure, with pores being smaller and more uniform than those of the YSZ coating.

organization.$: Department of Metallurgy and Materials Engineering

coredata.dc:description: In high-temperature applications such as hot sections of gas turbines, the sintering rate of the porous microstructure of a ceramic coating, and their mechanical and thermomechanical properties are important parameters for thermal barrier coating systems. In the present research, hardness, elastic modulus, thermal expansion, thermal stress and sintering rate of the porous microstructure of yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) and ceria-stabilized zirconia (CSZ) were investigated and compared using the thermal spray technique on IN738LC base metal in thermal cycling to 1100 °C. To determine the structural and phase characteristics of the coatings, scanning electron microscopy (SEM) and X-ray diffraction (XRD) analysis were employed. The experimental results showed that the CSZ coatings exhibit a considerably better sintering rate of the porous microstructure resulting in better mechanical, and thermomechanical properties when compared to the YSZ coatings. Moreover, the study of microstructures of coatings showed that the CSZ coating is formed with a laminar and porous structure, with pores being smaller and more uniform than those of the YSZ coating.
